channel.title: frankm tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from frankm.

item.description: Striding down the Riverwalk wearing purple https://t.co/Z2oNSXuX6G
Happy Friday! https://t.co/y8DiM8xLIm
Does free speech = trolling? https://t.co/IdYQTikqgd

Some server components of the Scripting News hosting infrastructure are down, for example my Old School blog is not reachable. Browser shows an error message saying the server refused connection. Watching attempt to access with the browser console ... https://t.co/8Q6fyAdhff

I don’t personally use Twitter as much as other social media platforms, so I really don’t have a personal investment in what happens to it, but I am deeply suspicious of Elon Musk buying Twitter. I suspect he wants to buy Twitter to have a personal ... https://t.co/SlgDyBbifx
I just earned the 'To Go Please (Level 22)' badge on @untappd! https://t.co/fzHeKqPdgE
I just earned the 'Untappd at Home (Level 22)' badge on @untappd! https://t.co/W6M90lMiTF
A day of warm sunshine does everyone and everything good. https://t.co/lyWo1s2IKV
Finally warm enough to put on shorts and go outside.
Finally some warm weather! Alpha tree is enjoying the sun too. https://t.co/1p6jwz90gT
I think Abraham Lincoln would be mad that for what was sacrificed years ago is simply being tossed aside today. https://t.co/98FYzNU0KA
A couple of Easter survivors. https://t.co/7Bis5LaHYF
Mother nature wishing me a happy birthday https://t.co/si4W1wbcmF
Day 1 of lap 57 around the sun does not have as nice weather (it is snowing) as lap 56 but is a great day none the less. https://t.co/df0d88YOpJ

“As the climax of Holy Week and the story of Jesus, Good Friday and Easter address the fundamental human question, What ails us? Most of us feel the force of this question—something is not right. So what ails us? Very compactly, egoism and injustice. ... https://t.co/hauD3qGrbc
I just earned the '2X (Level 7)' badge on @untappd! https://t.co/FOTI5UlOci
Last year nearly all of the flowering trees near us were blooming but this year most only have buds. However, the first tree to normally bloom has started but has a way to go. https://t.co/SjoMXB6QH4

Unlike Axios, I don’t think Musk’s desire for Twitter is as a tech mogul, instead his is simply wearing his billionaire hat. I think the wealthy like Musk are concerned about the negative reputation toward and potential cancel culture of the wealthy. ... https://t.co/MoSlL4PwTU
Setting Up A New iPad: https://t.co/319VVqCeXV

If Musk wanted to impress me he would get rid of Twitter’s algorithm completely and revert Twitter to a reverse chronological feed, citing how the algorithm is nothing more than feeding an addiction. We don’t need to see the algorithm, we need to get ... https://t.co/dvJ9DUYQj5
Day 1 of my long birthday weekend, aka retirement practice, has begun. I wish we were not experiencing below normal temperature that is made worse by above normal wind.

An authoritarin often claims to be the sole person who can make someone or something successful. Private ownership of Twitter by Musk has nothing to really do with democracy. His past record has done nothing for me to trust him.

Like many other Android users, when DarkSky for Android went away I moved to AccuWeather. AccuWeather has had a temperature indicator in its persistent notification that recently became just a dot and I’ve learned is that because they now put that ... https://t.co/SW1z0Nm1nL
Good news. A nasal spray in development to treat COVID is proving to be effective. The ideal of administering nasal spray to mice causes me to chuckle. https://t.co/D1R6Rj1hi3

Musk is now trying to buy Twitter. Imagine he owns Twitter and then runs for President of the United States. Would be forced to divest? A precident was set with Trump. If the sale proceeds there should be conditions that if he were to run for office ... https://t.co/Ql4dWlNRsg
